message.content:
{"id": "35156", "title": "Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 not working on some fields in the help search", "description": "When using Eclipse with DBCS locale, pressing ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the Help Search window does not trigger a help pop-up screen. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages and only happens on the first text field. Pressing ctrl+F1 on the subsequent fields works correctly.", "OB": "", "EB": "OS: LinuxGTK
Build: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRE

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search' from the menu bar.
3. When the Help Search window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.

Expected Result:
A help pop-up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.

Actual Result:
Nothing happens.

Comments:
1. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages.
2. The attached screenshot highlights the specific field that is not responding to ctrl+F1 (circled in red), while fields circled in green work properly.", "SR": ""}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '35156', 'title': 'Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly. ', 'SR': ''}
